text:
*[Bug 18663] New: Add 'contrib' modules to opencv*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18663>

            Bug ID: 18663
           Summary: Add 'contrib' modules to opencv
           Product: Rtools
           Version: 4.3
          Hardware: Other
                OS: Other
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Toolchain and libraries
          Assignee: <mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>
          Reporter: <mailto:jeroen@berkeley.edu|jeroen@berkeley.edu>

Would it be possible to include the opencv_contrib modules with the opencv
package, similar to e.g. msys2 and homebrew and Debian:

 -
<https://github.com/msys2/MINGW-packages/blob/master/mingw-w64-opencv/PKGBUILD>
 - <https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/blob/HEAD/Formula/o/opencv.rb>
 - <https://packages.debian.org/trixie/libopencv-dev>

The opencv R package for example uses the wechat QR decoder module.

text:
*[Bug 18664] New: Enable libnghttp2  in libcurl for http2 support*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18664>

            Bug ID: 18664
           Summary: Enable libnghttp2  in libcurl for http2 support
           Product: Rtools
           Version: 4.3
          Hardware: Other
                OS: Other
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Toolchain and libraries
          Assignee: <mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>
          Reporter: <mailto:jeroen@berkeley.edu|jeroen@berkeley.edu>

Would it be possible to add libnghttp2 to libcurl? This is needed to support
HTTP2.

Also it would be nice to remove the transitive dependency on libgcrypt/gpg via
libssh2, which is a hassle and does not work well. Instead you can build
libssh2 with openssl (which is already a dependency of libcurl anyway) or using
the native Windows TLS.

Would it be possible to add libnghttp2 to libcurl? This is needed to support
HTTP2.

Also it would be nice to remove the transitive dependency on libgcrypt/gpg via
libssh2, which is a hassle and does not work well. Instead you can build
libssh2 with openssl (which is already a dependency of libcurl anyway) or using
the native Windows TLS.
